page.title: 17WILDLIFE AND GAME
page.content: The presence of two canals,namely the Staffordshire and Worcestershire and the now disused Wyrley branch canal, provide ample food and nesting places for a wide variety of water-loving creatures.Over the past year herons, kingfishers,swans,mallards and moorhens have nested and fed there.A family of domestic geese are also raised on the canal and wander into nearby gardens in the winter looking for food.Canada Geese winter on Hawkins Pool at Little Saredon.The sportsman is catered for with canal fishing (angling rights owned by a working men's club) and at Barkers Pit (private pool - licence required).Partridge and pheasant abound in the area,but there is no organised shooting.Foxes,rabbits and squirrels abound in the area as there is no local gamekeeper at present.
